item.description:
From the box:
It has been 5 years since Ben used Omnitrix. He once again uses the all powerful Omnitrix when he finds out that his grandfather Max is missing. New alien army does not make his life any easier.
Help Ben in his new adventure.

Content:
-game board
-4 pawns
-rules
-12 tiles

Game Play

Place each of the 12 tiles next to the game board. Each player then chooses one of the colors and places their pawn on the to the corresponding space on the board.
Youngest player begins.
When ever you stop on Ben 10 symbol, you gain one tile.

In game:
with 2 players each can get up to 6
with 3 players up to 4
with 4 players up to 3

When ever someone have the necessary amount of tiles, then all tile spaces are deactivated. Pawns cannot fight each other, but when they are on the same space, then the one who was there earlier give one tile to the player that just got there. If he has no tiles to give, he misses his turn

Special spaces

Alien X - Ben 10 can move faster by 3
Ben, Kevin and Gwen - miss 1 turn
Green circle - Ben has a date with Julia. Miss 2 turns.
Max - miss 3 turns.
Jetray - Ben can move faster by 4

Winning

First player to get needed amount of tiles and reaches finish is the winner.

item.description:
You and your rivals are locked in a struggle of heroic proportions. Only assembling “KABOOM”, the ultimate weapon, can end the mayhem and crown you the top-dog of Superhero Land. Use your wits to activate special powers to defuse opponents and defend yourself from the onslaught of incoming attacks.

Tic Tic Boom is the explosive new family card game chock-full of strategy and sabotage. Set to a retro comic book motif, and manufactured on durable transparent plastic; the cards are as fun to pick up as they are to play.

Included are two entirely different games. Tic Tic Boom “Classic” offers something for all ages and skill levels. Players race to spell “KABOOM” on a communal board, while activating special powers along the way. It’s quick to learn and full of surprises. Tic Tic Boom “Advanced” is for gamers who thirst for a little more strategy, cunning, and sabotage. This game introduces Power Attacks, which are made by combining your cards to spell words such as BAM, BOOM, or K.O. These score points and provide even higher levels of high-jinx.

With more strategy than Uno and more excitement than Rummy, Tic Tic Boom is something the whole family will enjoy!

First title in the Famous Five Adventure Games book series. A "make your own adventure game" based on the Famous Five children's book, "Five Go Down to the Sea".

Players start at the first paragraph and roll the Famous Five die to select the first step on their adventure. In subsequent paragraphs, players receive instructions about how to proceed: they must make decisions about which way to go next, roll the die, or solve clues using the included playing cards (in the shape of various tools, such as a torch or a codebook). The more clues solved, the better chance of unraveling the final mystery. And running out of provisions (picnic cards) automatically ends the adventure!

From the back of the book:

In this original series of Adventure Game Books, YOU decide what they do and whether they solve the mystery or not.

Everything you need to play the game is contained within the book in your own Adventure Wallet. Inside it, you will find: the book, a set of playing cards consisting of a rucksack; codebook; torch; measure card; map — and to refresh you on your journey, a lunchbox and picnic cards! There is even a special Famous Five dice!

The game can be played over and over again, as many times as you like. For there are a variety of routes to the solution and each route involves different clues and adventures.

Fifth title in the Famous Five Adventure Games book series. A "make your own adventure game" based on the Famous Five children's book, "Five Go to Demon's Rocks".

Players start at the first paragraph and roll the Famous Five die to select the first step on their adventure. In subsequent paragraphs, players receive instructions about how to proceed: they must make decisions about which way to go next, roll the die, or solve clues using the included playing cards (in the shape of various tools, such as a torch or a codebook). The more clues solved, the better chance of unraveling the final mystery. And running out of provisions (picnic cards) automatically ends the adventure!

From the back of the book:

In this original series of Adventure Game Books, YOU decide what they do and whether they solve the mystery or not.

Everything you need to play the game is contained in your own Adventure Wallet. Inside it, you will find a book and a selection of playing cards including a codebook, measure card, torch, map, and rucksack — and to refresh you in your adventure, a lunchbox and picnic cards! There is even a special Famous Five dice!

The game can be played over and over again, as many times as you like. For there are a variety of routes to the solution and each route involves different clues and adventures.

From the designer:
"Storm The Castle - Print, make and play this adventure game. You are a knight and you have to storm through the castle and overthrow the King! Along the adventure you run into guards, wandering beasts and more. Totally free game that you can print up, assemble and play. Including a paper dice if you don't have one."

From the Rules:
"You progress through the castle by rolling six sided dice. Whatever number shows on the dice is the number of squares forward you can move. If you land on a square with a red number in it you must refer to that number in this [the] rule book and follow the instructions."

From back of book:

TechCommander is a fast paced sci-fi action tactical game that puts you in the command chair of a hi tech operations center leading an elite squad on dangerous missions! TechCommander combines miniature gaming with the sci-fi action seen in first person shooters and sci-fi real time strategy video games. The game has powerful Mechanized Strike Vehicle units (called MSV’s for short) that can destroy targets in seconds, but also has the ultimate in elite power armor infantry units. These units are based on a possible progression of future soldier programs in development in the modern day, and are equipped with technology to keep them agile, powerful and somewhat safe from the monster MSV’s roaming the landscape. The infantry are jump jet equipped, and in many cases, running a visibility and sensor masking stealth suit. Many also have capacitance based shield meaning if you do not fully eliminate them, they will recharge! The MSV may be powerful, but left unguarded, it is no match for a crack squad of USSC Force Recon Marines! TechCommander MSVs are fairly large miniatures, standing anywhere from four inches to a foot high. They use a peg-together system so that swapping out weapons and gear for a battle that requires a custom load out is easy!

name.value: Birth of a Legend: Lee and the Seven Days

item.description:
Simulation of the Seven Days' Battles which started Robert E. Lee on the road to glory.

The setting is the Union’s Peninsula Campaign in the spring of 1862. McClellan has formed and trained a large army, transported it by sea in an outflanking maneuver, marched it to the gates of the Confederate capital, and is poised to capture the city and probably bring an end to the rebellion. On the Confederate side Lee has taken over the Army after Johnston was wounded. Unlike Johnston, who was content to fight a largely defensive campaign, Lee gathered every unit he could get his hands on and launched his own offensive. The Union had placed its army in an awkward position, with one corps north of Chickahominy River and the rest south of it. Lee’s plan, and the position of the units when the game starts, was to crush the Union Corps and then drive the rest of McClellan’s army from the capital, destroying as much of it as he possible could. With that accomplished he would have a free hand to turn north.

The system is a simplified version of two games, the last area-impulse Avalon Hill published, Breakout: Normandy, and MMP's Monty's Gamble: Market Garden.

The game features leaders who are rated for initiative and combat effectiveness. Another mechanism in the game is the “advantage” marker which can be traded to the opponent to do things like rally, conduct a combined assault, declare a heroic defense that turns a success into a stalemate, or receive additional replacements.

The victory conditions are based on territorial control. For the Union that was Richmond. For the Confederacy that was the Union supply heads – White House Landing and Harrison’s Landing – and Malvern Hill. A key decision for the Union player is when to shift his supply train from White House Landing to the more secure location at Harrison’s Landing.

The unit scale is divisional including artillery and cavalry.

There is the campaign game, and a few optional rules. Playing time should be under three hours between experienced players.

item.description:
In a reversal of roles, all players in Munchkin Zombies start out as zombies, and the "monsters" are the normal people trying to stop the zombie invasion (such as the Action Hero, Soccer Mom, Fireman, etc.). Unlike most Munchkin games, there are no classes or races; instead, you can have a mojo: Atomic Zombie, Plague Zombie, and Voodoo Zombie. As with Munchkin Bites! and Super Munchkin, Munchkin Zombies includes powers – special abilities that you can play as you gain levels.

Guest artist is Alex Fernandez, who drew the Meals on Wheels card.

Part of the Munchkin series.

Munchkin is a satirical card game based on the clichés and oddities of Dungeons and Dragons and other role-playing games. Each player starts at level 1 and the winner is the first player to reach level 10. Players can acquire familiar D&D style character classes during the game which determine to some extent the cards they can play.

There are two types of cards - treasure and encounters. Each turn the current players 'kicks down the door' - drawing an encounter card from the deck. Usually this will involve battling a monster. Monsters have their own levels and players must try and overcome it using the levels, weapons and powers they have acquired during the game or run away. Other players can chose to help the player or hinder by adding extra monsters to the encounter. Defeating a monster will usually result in drawing treasure cards and acquiring levels. Being defeated by a monster results in "bad stuff" which usually involves losing levels and treasure.

Note: The 2012 edition of Munchkin Zombies from Pegasus Spiele includes the first expansion, Munchkin Zombies 2: Armed and Dangerous.

item.description:
From the publisher:

Incredible Adventures in Energy Land is a board game created for the employees of Eesti Energia (Estonian Energy) to gain a better insight into the values of the company. It’s a family adventure game combining strategic elements with the luck factor inherent to board games.

The game route has to be created at the beginning of every new game. Thus, the game is always fresh, surprising and visually exciting. With the help from six characters - creatures connected to a certain form of energy - the player has to complete different assignments and answer questions related to different forms of energy by getting reacquainted with the basic knowledge or by learning something new.

The visual language is bright, colorful and playfully modified from different Nordic mythologies. The characters and the Energy Land itself are inspired by all the different energy forms known to man.

Kings Court is a Western Chess variant played on a large 8X12 board.

The game incorporates the standard array of King, Queen, 2 knights, 2 bishops and 2 rook.

Kings Court then adds two Chancellor and two jester pieces.

From the game company's website:

THE CHANCELLOR-Has two possible moves (1) it can move one or two square in any direction. (2) it can move one square on the rank or file and then while still moving away from the square from which it started, moves one square on the diagonals. This is not a line move but a move from point to point and can not be obstructed by any other piece. See figure 1.

THE JESTER- Moves one or two squares on the diagonals. Unlike the Bishop the Jester can change directions while in motion, if desired. It may not return to the square from which it stared in the same move. See figure 2. For the first move from its initial square the jester may jump two square diagonally. All pieces with the exception of the Pawn, capture in the way it can legally move.

The King is also afforded an additional special move;

KING'S FLIGHT- is a move made by the King when in check by the Chancellor. The move is executed by moving the King two squares in any direction instead of its usual one square.

Spartan chess is a chess variant played on a standard 8x8 chess board. The two sides have pieces and pawns with different characteristics and capabilities. Such differences you would expect between opponents on an actual ancient battlefield.

The Black side represents the Spartans and the White the Persians. The Persians have pawns, pieces, an initial placement, and move in accord with the rules of orthodox chess.

The Spartans have two Kings and with the exception of their Kings, every Spartan playing piece moves differently from any piece found in orthodox chess.

Spartan Chess Features:
• A Persian army (white) identical to that of orthodox chess
• A Spartan army led by two Kings
• Spartan pawns (hoplites) that move differently than orthodox pawns
• Spartan pieces that move differently than any found in orthodox chess

item.description: It's time to "free your Glee". Show your friends how much you know about the show. Ask questions of your teammates so you can guess the glee character. Then your teammates act, sing, dance, do whatever they must to get you to guess what that character does. All the time you're holding the "Glee-full" holder with the answer card over your head. Hurry, before time runs out and the school bell rings.

The game's theme is based on the GameBoy Version of Nintendo's "Super Mario Land" from 1989.

Story
Princess Daisy of Sarasaland was kidnapped by the monster Tatanga. Super Mario and Luigi travel through the kingdoms of Birabuto, Muda and Easton to reach the kingdom of Tschai where the princess is held. The first player who reaches Tschai and beats the evil Tatanga and the other players frees the princess and wins the game.

Contents:

 1 Board
 8 Figures in 4 different Colors
 1 Dice
 60 Cards




Flow of Play
Each player has two figures (Mario and Luigi). Players roll a die to determine how far one of their figures can move. The board has some special places like traps and questionmarks. Traps cast the figure some spaces back. Questionmarks let the player draw one of the cards. On these player may find enemies which can be fought by a die roll or special items which let them avoid traps or enemies. The player who reaches the final place with both figures has to defeat the last enemy and the other players by rolling the dice.

item.description:
NotChess is a game on an 8X* board that is a checker-like game, using pieces called Alternators. Any piece is able to be captured by an opponent whose piece moves onto the square of the piece being captured. (By replacement)

The objective is to become the only player remaining on the board. 
 An Alternator moves as a chess knight when moving from a white square but it moves as a short range chess rook when moving from a black square. A player starts with six pieces on the rank closest to them.

Elephant Checkers is basically Turkish Checkers played on an Xiangqi Board with a extra rules and additional pieces. 
 Each player starts with 24 pieces (soldiers). The goal of the game is to leave your opponent with no moves (capturing all of their pieces does this nicely), or to promote an Elephant (a promoted Soldier) to King on the point in the center of your opponent's fortress.

As in many checker games captures are obligatory, and a player must choose the move with the most possible captures. 
 Soldiers move one square forward or horizontally. They may also capture an enemy piece (or a series of them) by jumping over it to a vacant junction beyond.

Once across the river a Soldier may move two squares or capture pieces two squares ahead or to the side, or capture a piece an adjacent piece and land two squares past it.

When a Soldier reaches the far side it promotes to an Elephant (the name source). 
 Elephants may move to any vacant junction (since Xiangqi is played on the points, not sqaures) vertically or horizontally. They capture by jumping over an enemy piece, and can continue to any empty square beyond the capture.

"They may promote to King and win the game if on the Throne point in the center of the opposing fortress, but that move counts as a non-capturing move, and can not be made when there is a capture available."

From the website:

The Scenario:
One year ago, Robert Killingsworth bought the farm. Six months later, he was dead - leaving his widow, Elizabeth, to tend to their fledgling winery and vineyard on the outskirts of California's wine country. With mounting debts and no clue as to how to run a business, Elizabeth is desperate to sell the farm and recoup her losses. The fierce drought and shaky economy, however, have left the Killingsworth Farm on the market for far too long.

One early autumn day, six people passed through the gates of Killingsworth Farm to see Elizabeth - one of them, a cold-blooded Killer...

Those Present at Killingsworth Farm:

Michael Nightshade: This real estate developer from New York arrived unannounced with plans to buy Killingsworth Farm and develop it into a low-cost housing community. His boss ordered him to obtain the Killingsworth land at any price…

Dr. Chelsea Barren: After suffering a nervous breakdown, this psychiatrist and best-selling author moved to Northern California to relax… but she moved next door to the Killingsworths instead.

Vicki D'Adly: Elizabeth's estranged sister from New Jersey, she and her husband were traveling on vacation when Vicki decided to drop by Killingsworth Farm for a visit… a surprise visit.

Norman D'Adly: A real estate broker from New Jersey and husband to Vicki, Norman is trying to salvage his job and his marriage while traveling across the country on vacation.

Kathryn Lawless: Best friend to Elizabeth, this local librarian and historian has a flare for the eccentric. She lives down the road with her 15 cats and loves true crime - especially the mysterious, unsolved death of Robert Killingsworth

Enrique Graves: This young drifter wandered onto Killingsworth Farm just as Robert and Elizabeth were moving in. Elizabeth took a liking to Enrique and he has lived on the farm ever since - tending to the fields… among other things.

Which of these people has a secret worth killing for? Come to Killingsworth Farm and find out before it is too late!

http://www.whodunitmysteries.com/sour.html

Virtue Cards
Attitudes and Actions of Excellence

Virtue Cards come as a standard deck of 52 poker-sized playing cards, each detailing a different Virtue.

However, the deck doesn't just contain an arbitrary list of Virtues. Instead, extensive research and experimentation has resulted in a systematic approach to classifying Virtues by several factors including Aspect, Focus, Type, & Rank.

Each Virtue Card defines the corresponding Virtue and gives a reference Bible verse along with a an easy to understand definition. Each card displays several symbols specific to the system to allow for quick visual reference. In addition, the cards have been implemented using normal suits and ranks allowing the cards to be used like a standard playing deck.

Ultimately, using the system makes learning and remembering the Virtues easy and fun as Virtue Cards can be used to play any existing card game with a "Virtuous twist" as well as games specifically designed for the system.

Wizard's Quest is a free print and play game in which you take the role of a wizard about to complete his training. In order to do this, you must defeat a creature called Gegenhound which lives in a place called "The Gether." The wizard advances around a the map via die roll and looks up events in a paragraph book depending on what square he landed in. The game has three ways it can be played: The wizard can learn The Path of Mind, Path of Nature, or The Path of Shadows (dark and deceptive magic). Each of these adds variety to the game by changing the victory conditions. The game also comes with three different difficulty levels which modify the total strength of The Gether.

name.value: Enter the Labyrinth and Rescue the Princess

item.description:
Enter the Labyrinth and Rescue the Princess is a free print and play game in which one or two players must explore a labyrinth to rescue a princess in an attempt to win her love.

The game has two paths to victory. In the first, you must try to find at least six of the princesses seven missing belongings in order to curry her favor. In the second, you must kill the labyrinth's minotaur and bring its horns to the princess to prove your courage.

The game uses a paragraph system for events. When a player lands in a square, he or she looks up that square in the paragraph book to see what happens.

In the two player game, the player who retrieves the most missing possessions wins. If one player slays the minotaur then he or she is the winner.

The DragonSlayer is a free print and play game in which the player must enter seven lairs and slay each the beast that lives there. Each time a beast dies, the player can collect the weapon that the beast had in it's lair. The weapons are humorous and include such things as a double barreled bazooka, a rocket sword, and a tank.

The combat system is very simple. Both the player and the beast have a starting health which is decreased by modified die roll. Depending on your weapon and the beast's strength the damage may be a die roll + 2, a combination of four dice rolled together, or similar modifiers. Each lair and weapon has it's own modifier. Assuming that you survive combat, you're health is automatically reset for the next cave.

Each beast is more difficult to kill than the last (culminating with the dragon in the 7th lair), but each new weapon is more powerful so the player's combat ability increases with the game's difficulty. The game is won by slaying the dragon.

Wicked Wickets is a cricket based table game suitable for the whole family, cricketers and non-cricketers alike, and can accommodate anything from two to twenty-two players. The game involves selection, bowling, batting, and active fielding, allowing for short over fast action games through to the complex realms of strategy found in test play. Although, like with cricket itself, the basics are simple and easily learnt, it will inevitably take a lifetime to master.

No prior knowledge of cricket is needed to play the game which is suitable for the whole family and up to 22 players. In essence the side that scores the most "runs" wins, though selecting the right players, the order they play, and where they are positioned all affect the outcome of the game. The basics of Wicked Wickets are really quite simple; the bowler throws the ball, in this case the red ball shaped die, and the batsman "hits" it by throwing the buff bat-shaped die. Adding the scores together shows how far the ball goes using the long flight measure. If the batsman's score is higher than the bowlers, the ball "flies" in the air; if the bowler's score is higher than the batsman's, then it is struck along the ground. The yellow counter and dice are used to show which direction the ball goes. The short pace measure is simply used to measure the distance players move and the green die is mostly used for fielding. The game cards give the individual abilities of the players affecting how and where they are used. However, as with most games there is often more to it than first meets the eye. --From the publisher

Official website: http://www.boadiceasbackyard.com/

Paraphrased from the game's instruction sheet:

A word game for two to four players, utilizing a deck of 112 cards with individual letters on them (4 of each constanant other than Z (of which there are 2) and 6 each of A,E,I,O and U). Players are dealt a hand of 9 cards. Game play consists of laying cards to form complete words, which are scored against a table. 
A player's turn begins by drawing a card from either the draw pile or the top of the discard pile, then continues with the laying of whatever words the player can make with the cards in his or her hand, then finishes with the laying of an additional card to the discard pile. Players may also capture words made by other players by adding letters to the played word to form a new word.
A round ends when someone fully discards his hand by playing a word or words. The player does not need to be able to discard a card if playing all cards into words.


A later version of this game was published together with the dice game Farkel; that game has a deck half the size.

Hansel is too greedy and wants to eat all the cookies from the roof of the witch her house. But he has to be carefull because the witch who is disguised as a pigeon will prevent him.

The board looks like a house with on top 3 places to put a card. Shuffle the deck of cards and put three cards on these locations. Then you put a pigeon figure on the roof in one of the three slots above a card. There is also a Hansel figure, place this on the table.

At his turn a player may turn over a card from the deck. If the card doesn't match the card under the pigeon nothing happens and the player may take the card. The player can turn over as many cards as he wants. If he wants to stop he can take all the cards that he has turned over. But if he turns the same card that is under the pigeon then the player has to make the sound of a pigeon and take the pigeon figure from the roof to prevent the witch from coming down. At the same time each other player may try to take the hansel figure. The first person who does this gets the first card of the open pile, and all the cards go to a discard pile. So the player who turned the cards lost all his cards (except maybe one). The witch is then put in a slot on the roof again.

A player that took Hansel by mistake has to give in a card he won in a previous round.

When the drawing deck is empty the game stops. The player with the most cards wins the game.

Subtitle of this old Dutch game: "Intellectueel en interessant gezelschapsspel voor jong en oud". 
Up to 6 player try to voyage around the world as fast as possible. Each player follows a 'private' route and has to visit 20 different places. It is also possible that 'somtehing' happens during the trip...

Arkana MiÅ‚oÅ›ci (Arcana of Love) is an exclusive erotic card game for couples who are not afraid of new challenges.

This best-selling Polish game is close to the LCG format (living card game). In the basic box you can find 55 cards and a rule booklet. During the gameplay the participants have 5 kinds of cards (arcana, challenges, actions, counter-actions and special actions)at their disposal. Every person has 5 cards on hand and can use three of them in any combination. The game ends when one of the players (the game was designed for an unlimited number of players, but of course it will be played mostly by couples) is naked and an "arcana" card is played.

So far one expansion pack has been published, with more to come in the future.

item.description: Based on famous TV show from the 1950's starring Ralph Edwards. In it, famous people would be surprised by Edwards and would wind up on his show where people from that celebrities past would appear as special guests. The object of the game was to fill in as many of the areas of the celebrities past as possible including using the Charm Bracelet for friends and family. This game lets you figure out which famous person Edward's has chosen to honor during the game.

Vintage is about the Douro River Valley of Portugal, the oldest demarcated wine producing region in the world, designated World Heritage, and the production of port wine. Each player will attempt to buy wine-growing estates and plant them with the best grape varieties to try and produce the highest quality port wine - a VINTAGE.

This game has a simple version and a normal version. The simple version is aimed at players who are not used to this kind of family strategy games. The game has fewer options and a higher degree of luck. It plays faster and is easy to learn.

With the normal version you will discover the VINTAGE game in its fullness, with many more strategic options and where luck plays a minor role. It’s a longer and more challenging game but with only slightly more complex rules. Cheers!

item.description: The players move their five pieces with numbers on them around the board trying to put at least three of them in line with a total of 5 or a multiple of 5. They then write down the sum as score points and continue playing until one player reaches 200.

ScrumBrawl is a board game where players control fantastic creatures vying for supremacy within the Arena, scoring goals by maneuvering various types of enchanted orbs into portals set within the Arena or fighting other creatures to the death to prevent them from reaching the portals. The 100-card deck contains fifty creatures with different characteristics that determine how the creature interacts with the orbs (throw accuracy, catching ability, and throwing range), how fast a creature can move, and how effective it is in battle. Many creatures also have unique magic abilities that can be used to manipulate gameplay.

When players summon creatures, corresponding creature tokens (miniature cards that stand erect in cardstands) enter the 20x20 square gameboard, known as the Arena, where the orb and portal tokens await the contestants. In a four-player game, players may compete in teams of two. Goals are scored by creatures that maneuver an orb token onto a portal token by picking up, carrying, handing off, and throwing the orb with their creature tokens. Additionally, players can score goals (known as Skins) by successfully destroying opponents' creatures in combat. Combat results are determined by dice rolls as are the success of throws and catches of the orb between creatures. A number of Alter Reality cards allow players to change the values of individual rolls which make the outcome of every roll something that can quickly be challenged.

Enchantment cards can be played on creatures to grant them enhanced stats or new abilities as well as make them hardier in combat. Event cards, such a Lightning Storms or Fumbles can change the flow the game in seconds forcing players to constantly rethink their strategies for scoring or engaging in combat.

The game ends when a player or team reaches three goals, one of which must be a non-skins goal. No lead is safe and no two matches are ever the same making each game a unique and often humorous experience. The name is the combination of Scrum (a Rugby term where players strive for possession of the ball) and Brawl (a roaring fight, in our case, to the death). ScrumBrawl is the inaugural title for VicTim Games LLC.

Game time ranges from 20-40 minutes for a 2 player game, 30-45 minutes for a 3 player game, and 40-60 minutes for a 4 player game.

item.description:
The year is 5777. 3,000 years ago the scientists thought that the Sun was going to explode. Therefore the humanity had to leave Earth, looking for a hospitable planet. Four different empires were created and they forgot the solar system and the planet where the humanity evolved. Now, 3,000 years later, the scientists have discovered that the solar system still survives. Each of the four empires decide to conquer the cradle of humanity for itself... a space conflict is about to erupt!

Kosmojet is an educational game on the Solar System and for developing memory and dexterity skills. Each player represents one empire and must reconquer the Solar System planet by planet by means of a classical memory-style competition as well as some dexterity matches.

From Zillions of Games

"Pieces move diagonally but capture orthogonally. This is so as to combine the forced progression of diagonal checkers with the richness of the orthogonal game.

Object: Capture all your opponent's pieces ("Checkers" or "Kings") by jumping over them, or stalemate the opponent so he has no moves.

Checkers can move diagonally forward, by sliding to an adjacent empty square or by jumping either left, right, or forward over an enemy piece to a vacant square on the other side. Jumping over a piece captures it, but you may not jump diagonally. Capturing is mandatory, and you must keep jumping and capturing as long as it is possible, taking the maximum number of pieces.

The King is a long range piece and can slide diagonally in any direction or jump left, right, up or down over any opponent piece to any free square. When your Checker stops on the other end of the board, it becomes a King and can then also move backwards. If it merely visits a promotion square during a series capture moves, then it does not promote."

From Hopperdame website ( http://hem.passagen.se/melki9/hopperdame.htm )

HopperDame (or simply Hoppers) is a new invention. In HopperDame with promotion rule you win by capturing all the opponent's pieces. Pieces move forwards and sideways, orthogonally or diagonally, by shifting to an adjacent square, or by jumping over an adjacent friendly piece (also termed 'hopper'). Jumps must only occur over a piece of the same colour. It's not allowable to step or jump backwards. The exception to this is the "king", which can jump over any piece, and step in all directions.

To promote to king one must conquer the "castles", that is, the corner squares behind the enemy position, by holding both these positions with a piece, so called "double-promotion". If a piece steps or jumps into the enemy corner then it is promoted to king only if the other enemy corner is already occupied by a friendly piece. Also, a piece which steps into the corner square may later be promoted if the other corner has subsequently become occupied by a friendly piece. The promotion is then done by dropping the piece on the same square. But this costs a move.

HopperDame employs the rule of exchange-capture: the counter jumps over a friendly counter. If the square where it lands is occupied by an enemy counter, then this is captured. It is only when leaping that the counter can make captures. A leaping counter may continue to leap over friendly counters until there are no more to leap over or the player decides to stop. It's not allowable to jump back to the square you just came from.

Note that capture is only made when jumping. Thus, a single piece cannot make a capture by itself. The exception to this is the king, which has an additional capture method: it can capture an adjacent enemy piece directly, like a king in chess.

SUMMARY:

Poker Face is a board game of betting/wagering, not Lady Gaga, and money can NOT be used in playing the game. Each game consists of 7 matches. In the beginning of each match, a Match Card is drawn. Players follow the steps on the card to prepare the match, place bets and play action cards to alter the result in their favors. When the objective meets after playing rounds of action cards, the match ends. The winners receive points and the losers may receive penalty based on their bets. After 7 matches, player with the highest score wins the game.

COMPONENTS:

Board x 1
Objective Cards x 8
Action Cards x 108
Starting Player token x 1
Player token x 24
Power token x 8
Game Round marker x 1
Rule x 1


 
 
 


1) First edition is Simplified Chinese.
2) There are 36 types of action card, based on the ancient Chinese 36 stratagems.

Publisher Blurb:

Pass the Popcorn's movie fun is now a fast-paced matching card game! You love movies but how well do you remember details about the cast, characters and plot? Do you know which movie plots feature time travel or crooked cops? The game is started by dealing a hand of themed Popcorn Cards to each players. From the back of the box:

You're in Trouble!...No! You're in DOUBLE TROUBLE! In fact, you've got a whole handful of DOUBLE TROUBLE!--"Bad News!" cards, "Double Trouble" cards, and a bunch of other penalty cards - All against you!

Quick! Dump your Trouble cards - On The Double! - By playing two at a time. Then dump even more by PASSING them to your opponents. Be first to go out (and WIN!), sticking your opponents with DOUBLE TROUBLE if you can.

Playing cards by number and color (similar to Uno), the player to get rid of all of their cards first wins the round. This Gamebook Worldwise is the first exciting question and answer game that will lead you across the whole world. The gamebook contains more than 5000 questions divided in three age categories: from 8-11, 11-16 and 16 years and older. To put it short: a game for the complete family.
The more you know, the further you will get! With the gamebook Worldwise one can enlarge ones knowledge on the field of: voyages of discovery, expressive art, worldseas, nature, music, tourism, sports and many other subjects.
Casablanca - Anton Geesink - origami, H2O - barracudas - drift currents and Beaujolais. Fascinating names out of the challenging gamebook Worldwise that will put to the test everybodies knowledge to their limits.

item.description:
Players are gold miners, travelling first from east coast to west to dig gold, and then return back to east coast with money. Each state is owned by one player, and other players need to pay taxes, when entering the state.

Players can travel by walking or with horse by rolling the dice, with these options it is possible to get anywhere on the board. There are also some railroads on the east of Mississippi, these provide a constant travel speed, but they do cost something. It is also possible to travel with boats, this is very fast, but also very expensive.

Getting over the Mississippi river or over the Rockies is always a risky business. when players stop on special spots on the map, they need to draw one Chance card, which is usually trouble, but there are some good things also.

Once players get to the West, they can visit mining spots and dig gold, this is done simply by drawing one treasure card. Most of them are empty, but there are some gold (and other) valuable cards. When player finds gold, he needs to change it to cash in Los Angeles and return all the way back to East coast. The player who first finds gold, changes it to cash in LA and returns to East coast, is the winner.

What is worse? Addressing congress or being naked in public? Or addressing a naked congress? Or being naked, while addressing a naked congress? Or sitting on a baby?

These are the kinds of things you'll have to figure out when you play "What Could Be Worse?"

You and several of your friends (or maybe they're strangers, or maybe you're playing this in prison where the other people aren't quite strangers but don't really count as friends) take turns deciding what to compare your comparisons to.

Roll a die to figure out whether it's something Worse, Better, or As Bad As a card from your hand.

Then there's a lot of cards with funny crap on them, and whatever- there's no point teaching the game in a blurb. Buy the game, play it, laugh your butt off, and thank us later.

item.description:
Huckepack durch die Wüste - freely translated "Porters through the Desert" - is a adventurous dice game.

Game components:
- a cloth game board, 49 x 49 cm
- 4 sets of 3 wooden game pawns (12 in total)
- 1 die
- the rules

From the game:
Somewhere in Arabia, in a small settlement on the border of the never ending desert, a great tension can be felt. In the shadow of an old palm tree four bold nomad sons are planning a dare-devil adventure. What is their plan? Will they really try to cross the desert by the infamous west route? Don't they know the treacherous quicksand and all those other dangers which lie in wait for them? Have no fear! With cautiousness, good companionship and some luck this route is passable. Each caravan still has one place open - dare this adventure and join them!

The rules:
Each player has three pawns with which to reach the large oasis in the middle of the board. Pawns are moved by throwing the die. A pawn can get stuck in quicksand, and then has to be rescued by another pawn of the same player. (Optional: or by rolling a six.) A rescued pawn is carried on the back of the other to the next oasis, where the pawn which was stuck has to rest till another pawn ends its turn there, or a six is rolled by the player.

When a pawn ends its move on a field where another pawn already is, it can climb on the others back, and be carried/ported by it. This is possible with both your own or other players pawns. (Multiply carrying is allowed.) However: a carried pawn should hop off before reaching the next oasis, as once the porter reaches it, it will drop off all carried pawns in the oasis! And likewise with resting pawns from being stuck in the quicksand: formerly carried pawns will have to rest till another pawn ends its turn there, or a six is rolled by the corresponding player.

When a pawn ends it turn on a place from which a short track continues (shown by a road sign), this may be taken on the next turn. Any carried pawns are carried along.
To reach the end oasis, a pawn has to reach it, either by throwing the required number exactly or higher.

Winner of this adventurous journey is the player who has crossed the desert with his or her three pawns first.

"Roue Breizh / The Lords of Brocéliande" is strategy game set during the Dark Ages in the Celtic land of Brittany (the north-west corner of France). In the Breton language "Roue Breizh" means "King of Brittany" (Roue is pronounced "Roué", the old pronunciation of the French word Roi or King). The game comes with an educational booklet setting out the history of what was, to the medieval mind, a mystical land associated with the knights of the Round Table and the legendary forest of Brocéliande.

In this game, players play the feudal lords of Brittany who have survived the fall of Rome (or have fled from their original homeland: Britain) and now face barbarian invasions from the sea and the encroachments of the Frankish kingdom from the east. The Breton lords gradually settle and connect up their different domains, establishing towns and defending themselves against the terrible Vikings and Northmen. The aim of the game is to found ever larger baronies, counties and duchies, whether on one's own, or in combination with the domains of an ally. At the end of the game, one of these lords will be crowned King of Brittany: the "Roue Breizh"!

Mechanisms: Kingdoms are made and unmade, alliances are formed at will. There's no elimination of players. Instead, players are given the chance to form alliances, and may freely give and receive lands as they make or break alliances at the end of each turn. During a turn, members of the same alliance are not allowed to attack each other. Being a member of a strong alliance will allow each player in the alliance to have a better dice-roll in times of conflict. Some players are also members of the Council of Brocéliande, which gives its members more power, but also - inevitably - the obligation to redistribute resources and to promote the development of other players instead! Gaming enthusiasts will certainly enjoy the fact that "Roue Breizh" gives a decisive advantage to team-play, through the principle of rotating "coalitions". Between each round of play, the formation and re-formation of teams gives rise to complex interactions between the players as they negotiate the terms of their alliance.

(This is an amended version of the summary published on the Tric Trac website, in French).

(from Battles website:)

Wagram 1809 simulates one of Napoleon's greatest victories. After the troubling defeat at Essling on 22 May 1809, and still holding Vienna, Napoleon needed to renew his confidence and finish the campaign.
For the second time, Napoleon crossed the Danube to meet the force of Archduke Charles. This time, however, preparations for the crossing were better and during the night of 4-5 july he managed to get most of his troops across.
The battle of Wagram could then commence, and it would last for two days.

The game is at divisional scale and uses a plotted system of moving army corps with alternating activations of units during the turn. There is no CRT and units become progressively weaker during the battle.
For Wagram 1809, Laurent Martin has used an adaptation and evolution of the system he has already used for the battle of Bull Run and Cedar Creek, which appeared in Vae Victis.

item.description:
Tactical level wargame based on the Chinese historical novel "Romance of the Three Kingdoms". This game covers field combat of the early episodes of the novel, and does not include later episodes siege combat.

Players control warlord forces at the end of the Han dynasty. The purpose of the game is to eliminate enemy troops.

Players organize their units secretly.
Search and leader's ability are the most important elements of the game. Surprise and preemptive attacks occur under search condition. 
Leaders' duels are first resolved in battle. Then leaders attack opponent force, and finally force combat is resolved.

NOTE: this game has no direct relation with the same publisher's "Romance of the Three Kingdoms". Both games only share the same background.

name.value: Souls of the Brave: the Epic of the Alamo

item.description:
Solitaire wargame, a print and play product, that mixes cards and dice to reproduce the most famous desperate battle of all time: the Alamo.
The player, as the Texans, must try to avoid that the far superior mexican force reaches the walls of the Alamo. The game uses a system reminescent of Butterfield's Raf, using cards for random activation of the Mexican force, while a combat system mutuated by Zulu Wars resolve each different combat situation that may arise during the game.

User Summary: This game is designed to help parents communicate and find new ways to think about their relationships with their children. Using a deck of cards, the game has various kinds of techniques to challenge a parent's view, and to help them see the world differently. For example, you might be asked to role-play a scenario, but with a specific attitude alien to your normal thinking. Or the card may ask a moral question, but you have to answer from the view of different ages. There are no 'right' or 'wrong' answers, and gamers may not consider Alles Paletti?! to be a game in the normal sense. But it is designed to use methods of play to bring out changes in people, without accusations and finger-pointing.

The marriage of checkers and Gomoku.

Played on an 8X8 board, with 12 checkers each.

The game is played in two phases.

1) To start the game each player places a piece on an empty space and taking turns continue to do this until all pieces are on the board.

2) Then the second phase begins where they can move one piece each turn. A piece can move to any adjacent empty cell, in all 8 directions.

Players are attempting to create 5-in-a-row of their own colour either orthogonally or diagonally. When they achieve 5-in-a-row the player can remove one of the opponent's pieces.

The goal is to reduce the opponent's piece total to 4.

In doggie bones the players use memory and deduction to locate their bones. There are simple rules for ages 3-5 and regular rules for ages 6+.

item.description:
From the rules:

Content:
5 big leaf shaped double-sided boards
32 smaller leafs with pictures

Goal:
To find 1 unique picture on each board.
Each round winner will receive 1 small pictured card. Get 5 cards to win the game.

Set-Up:
Set all 5 board so everyone could see them.Don't matter how or which way the boards are places, there always are only 1 picture same on each board.
32 smaller cards will remain with the game leader.

Game:
Game leader (older player) has all the 32 cards. He searched the one card that matches the picture on each board and placed it secretly before him. Only he/she knows that animal picture. To make it easier, game leaser may choose the right animal and other 4 animals and mix them and then place then on the table for everyone to see. One of them is the right one. The first one to name the right animal on each board, gets to keep the card. Cards should be hidden from other players.
Each players gets only 1 guess.
This goes until one player has gotten 5 cards.
After each round, game leader collects all board and places them in any order, only making sure that already picked animals would come up again.

Winner:
Game is over when 5th card for someone is collected.

From the box:
New game from Noris Spiele to help youngsters learn math like never before.
This board game that comes with a cool CD teaches youngsters all kinds of math, from adding to dividing.
But this is not just another boring math game, but this time each players had a mission cards and each time the game is different. Scores can be multiplied if you are smart or divided by your opponent if not careful enough.
Win this game by fulfilling you mission cards first.

From the box:
Game for small children to help them learn about animals and what sound they make.
Each player gets a board with 5 animals on it - sheep, cat, cow, dog and a pig. Each animal has a different colored background.

Then all wooden tiles are shuffled. Each tile has a picture of an animal on one side, a colored circle on the other side. All tiles are shuffled good and placed the colored circle upwards. Now starting with the youngest player, they turn around tiles. When player turns around a red circle and it has a cat on it (which has a blue background), he/she need to do red animals voice (cow) while doing the cat move (sitting straight and doing ears). If that player is successful, he may place that tile on his board, covering that picture (cat).

When player turn around a blue circle tile, with a blue picture (cat), he/she just need to make a sound.

The first player to get all 5 tiles is the winner.

name.value: The Society for Stacking Things on Top of Other Things

item.description:
Publisher Blurb: The Society for Stacking Things on Top of Other Things is a small, fast-playing deck building game for 2-4 players.

Players will build a deck by drafting cards from a communal pool. These cards consist of Action cards and Thing cards.

Players take it in turn to play actions which affect how many cards can be drafted into their deck during their turn. After doing so, they may place a thing card on their personal stack. Once this is done there is a cleanup phase. During this phase players replenish their hands to ready themselves for the next turn.
 Players attempt to create the biggest stack of Things. Each Thing is worth points. The first player to 1000+ points whom is able to place the Winner Flag on top of his stack is the winner.

item.description:
From the game box:

Q: Do you know a county like Vietnam?
A: Yes, of course!
Q: Can you show this on the map?
A: .... eee I....wait wait...
Q: Did you know that 87 million people live there?
A: ...OK...

Board game that you are holding is made for getting knowledge about geopolitical in a fun way and to spend time in a great way.
World is full of amazing stuff, look around and compare countries by size, population, economy and power - it makes you think.

You goal is to answer and show correct placement and collect 5 cards from each continent.
Game lasts until one player has collected 5 cards from each continent, or if each country is claimed by someone or is the game gets boring, then the ones who has most cards is the winner.

On your turn you roll two dice. One dice shows which of the continents you have to choose from (6 is free choice) and the other dice shows how many countries you can try for this turn. Then player collects 1 or more cards from the corresponding card pack and sets himself ready. Then 2 minute timer is activated and active players must show with small tokens where each of those selected countries are.

There are many many optional rules for game play.

This is a new game about Romania, a trivia game for your family and friends to enjoy.

There are 400 cards with a total of 2400 questions about Romania, covering 6 areas: history, culture, science, sports, geography and misc.

Contents:

- 400 cards with 2400 questions and answers;
- the board;
- 6 pawns;
- 6 puzzle pieces;
- 1 dice; 
- rules.

Roll the die to see from what category you will get your question. Once you answer one correct question from a category, you receive one puzzle piece. The first one to give a correct answer to a question from every category will make up Romania from the 6 puzzle pieces and win the game.

Be the first to find out how well you know your country, learn new things and have fun!

item.description:
"Busine[eS] - play social economy" is a biding game designed for one of polish NGO's - Foundation for Social and Economic Initiatives (FISE). It this game each player takes role of a leader of local government. His task is to develop structures of social economy in his area - job agencies, social assistance centers, NGO's etc... and take care of people who are looking for a job.

In each round players bid for projects of the institutions of social economy. Then they add it to their personal boards creating a system of social economy in their city. Later they need to help people looking for a job. There are three kinds of meeples representing different groups of people: green one are easiest to manage but they will give you the less points for finding them a job, the yellow ones are average, and the red meeples are people who needs a lot of time to prepare them to work but they are worth most points. At the end of each round if you haven't got enough space in your structures for the people looking for help you have to pay a penalty. In each round all of the meeples move one step closer to the left side of a players boards. When they leave the board it means they found a job and player receives points.

The game was designed as a learning tool for workers of polish jobs offices.

The game was self-published by Foundation for Social and Economic Initiatives (FISE)

link.value: Foundation for Social and Economic Initiatives (FISE)

item.description:
Battle Beast is the game player gather Beast warrior and fight other players

Game Play : Every one draw 5 cards from the same deck. When in their turn, They must form a team of beast warriors to attack another player and may play only one tactic card from their hand per turn. The defender may play one tactic cards and form a team of beast warrior from his hand to defend. If the Attacker win He claim VP equal to 1 + (different in number of beast warriors) and kill all defending warrior. If the defender win nothing happen and pass to next player turn

Goal : When 2 players are out of VP the game end and Who got the most VP win the game

A funny board game for 2 to 4 players.

Each player chooses the colour of his pawn and rolls a dice, then he moves his pawn. When he steps on the place with the blue circle, there’s something happening (good or bad, for example the player is missing his turn). On the red circles nothing happens. The winner of the game is the person who first will reach the place with the bears' house.

Goal: to build a 30x30 cm square using rectangular pieces of different colors while avoiding pieces of the same color to touch themselves.

Gameplay: The pieces are evenly distribute between the players. The first player puts one of his pieces over the table. The other players do the same, trying to build a square. Pieces of the same color cannot touch each other(horizontally, vertically or diagonally). The winner is, either the player that puts his last piece or, if there aren´t a possible move, the player that has fewe pieces left.

Goal: the attacking army (red) must occupy the throne (central position of the board). The defending army (yellow) must eliminate all pieces of the attacking army.

Gameplay: The pieces are distributed over the board following pre-configured positions: the defending army around the central position and the attacking army at the border. The red army starts the game, each player can move one piece per turn. A piece can be moved to any other adjacent empty space. During the game, the central piece can be used by the yellow army. The captures are made the same way as checkers. After a capture the same player continues playing as long as he can capture other pieces.

item.description:
After the latest rains, several colonies of ants are trapped by water. Should cooperate in building a bridge that allow them to leave, but without neglecting their familys. Must go to search of food, materials and to extend their anthill, care for the larvae, feed ants and defend against attacks from other insects. The best Developer colony will take the victory.

The players handled their own colony of workers and warriors, and will have to face all these challenges, carefully choose the most beneficial actions and learn to manage their ants, both the workers who are those will go for food and materials, and the warriors, which will give you protection against insects. You'll get victory points for contributions to the construction of the bridge, the good behaviour of your warriors, as well as at the end of the game for having the best developed colony.


Tras las ultimas lluvias, varias colonias de hormigas se encuentran atrapadas por el agua. Deben colaborar en la construccion de un vado que les permita salir, pero sin descuidar a su familia. Deberan ir en busca de materiales y alimento, ampliar su hormiguero, cuidar de las larvas, alimentar a las hormigas y defenderse de los ataques de otros insectos. La colonia mas trabajadora y mejor desarrollada se llevara la victoria.

Los jugadores manejaran su propia colonia de obreras y guerreras, y tendran que enfrentarse a todos estos desafios, elegir cuidadosamente las acciones mas beneficiosas y saber administrar sus hormigas, tanto las obreras que son las que iran por comida y materiales, como las guerreras, que te daran defensa contra los insectos. Conseguiras puntos de victoria por los aportes a la construccion del puente, por lo bien que se hayan portado tus guerreras, asi como al final del juego por tener la Colonia mejor desarrollada.

Krampus,the dark twin to that jolly elf Santa Claus, is tired of his diminished and secondary role in the Christmas holiday, and has booby-trapped Santa's sleigh. The sleigh has flown off on it's own and now it is a race: Krampus is out to ruin everyone's night by stealing gifts and Santa is trying to retreive the sleigh and deliver the presents.
The board consists of eighteen areas, the north and south poles which are the base points for the Santa and Krumpus players. The sleigh is placed in the center of the board. The game includes three dice, hand painted with both numbers and the following symbols:
1,2 :footprints
3,4 :sleigh
5 :a spring
6 :a hand
and on one die, a three is an asterisk, representing a wild face. The game may be played with normal dice, but one 3 face must be marked to represent the wild symbol.
Setup continues by rolling the dice six times (3d6) and laying cubes that represent the gift targets on the resulting spaces, which are numbered from 3-18 (1 and 2 are the poles, and will never have gift targets placed on them.)
The dice and the player's tokens are manipulated using the dice. Each turn the player may roll 3 times, keeping a die or two each time. If a die is kept, it must be used at the end of rolling, there is no deciding to reroll later. Whatever is rolled on the third roll is kept and used. 
Keep on footprint to move one space, two to move three spaces, and keep three footprints to move four spaces. Movement is orthogonal only, never diagonal.
Keep one sleigh to move the sleign one space orthogonally, two to move three, three to move hour. In addition, if the player's token is in the same space as the sleigh, you must roll two sleighs to board the sleigh. Once on the sleigh, the sleigh is moved with either footprints or sleighs (not a combination of both, though you may wait until the end of the third roll to decide which you will use to move the sleigh.) Move the sleigh to bring it closer to you, or to keep the other player from intercepting it. The sleigh may not be moved remotely if the other player is riding it.
Roll and keep three springs to eject a player riding the sleigh back to his or her base. (In variant play, any gifts on the sleigh at this point remain aboard) While unlikely, it is possible to eject yourself from the sleigh if you roll all three dice three times and it pops up. If so, too bad, back to base with yourself!
If on the sleigh and in the same space as a package, roll and keep two hands to deliver the package as Santa or steal the package as the Krampus. In either case, place the package in your base as a point. 
The wild symbol may substitute for any other in the above combinations.

Winner is player to pick up the most gift tokens when the last one is picked up, ties going to Santa, because it's Christmas, after all.

Variant Challenge 1: To 'win' a gift and get the point, you must return to your base with it (no roll required to drop it)

Variant Challenge 2: Use Variant Challenge 1, but the other player may also steal gifts from your base, and the winner is the first to get ALL the gifts.

T’was 9 minutes to takeoff and all round the castle,
Elves were scurrying about dealing with hassles.
Bernard, the head elf, screamed out in fear,
4 undone tasks might cancel Christmas this year.
“9 minutes ‘til Christmas! You, you, you and you,
Listen to me now, I will tell you what to do.
Get 4 bolts to repair Santa’s sleigh,
It can’t land on rooftops with a broken runner, OK?
Get 24 cups of flour to the baker right now,
Some of the Gingerbread men were mistakenly shipped to Fuzhou.
8 golden bells from the reindeer harness are missing,
Please get this fixed before the Big Man has a hissy.
From Santa’s red coat, 4 buttons are lost,
We must find and replace them, whatever the cost.
These things must be done, but a bad storm is near.
If we can’t do them all in 9 minutes, there will be NO Christmas this year!”
Ready for the challenge, the team sprang to its work. . .

9 Minutes to Takeoff is a cooperative game for 2 – 4 people, ages 8 – Adult, lasting 30 to 60 minutes. This game was designed as an entry in the BoardGameGeek.com 2010 Christmas Print and Play Game contest.

Your team of North Pole denizens must work together to prevent the greatest tragedy of all time: No Christmas. A blizzard is heading for the North Pole and snow is making certain areas impassible. To win you must work together as a group to clear the snow around Santa’s Castle so that you can complete the four required tasks and return to the castle by flying reindeer before time runs out. If however, the countdown clock runs out before you can complete your tasks, there will be no Christmas and Everyone, Everywhere will lose.

PvP is a quick 20-30 min, 2 player fantasy card game where players use teams of combatants to try to be the last man standing!
The game is easy to learn and play, offers many interesting challenges and replayability.

The objective of the game is to wipe out all of the opponent's characters. Each character can only take a certain amount of damage.
Each turn, players roll 6 Six-sided die three times, keeping any number of die between each roll. At the end of the third roll, players assign dice to characters they control. Each character has abilities which correspond to specific die combinations. (Eg. Fireball requires a straight, a strike requires a pair, etc...)

Characters are divided into teams which provide special bonuses if at least 2 members of the same team are present. Each of the 12 characters possess unique abilities. Advanced rules allow for customization of character teams, allowing endless re-playability!

For more info on motivation behind the game, head over to
http://www.indiegogo.com/PvP-A-card-and-dice-iOS-game?a=476297
